channel.title: Need help with my server plz!
channel.description: I have followed the tutorial and my server works for me on 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 buy not on my no-ip adresse plz help some one if you help me i will give you co - owner on my server

item.title: Need help with my server plz!
item.dc:creator: @Pk2pk_Owner Pk2pk Owner
item.description:
@Pk2pk_Owner wrote:

[quote=“Berky-Scape, post:10, topic:225030”]if you wan’t some help with the firewall to allow things?
Do this : go to start on your computer
2. click on the button with confrigation or something like that.
3. click on the shield thing named security center (i got a dutch computer and i’m dutch cuz that i don’t know how it looks like on the enlish computers)
4. click on firewall
5. you will see a little screen click above on “exceptions” and typ the things what you wan’t to allow on your firewall

i hope this helped
it helped not? tell your problems to me than i look how to fix.[/quote]

ok i done that… but its still not working i dont see the problem plz help lol :[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 12, 2008, 12:33:43 pm[/size][hr]THANKS GUYS I GOT MY SERVER UP AND RUNNING THANKS TO YOU PEOPLE THANKS ALOTTTTTT!!! REP ++++++++

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with my server plz!

item.title: Need help with my server plz!
item.dc:creator: @Berky-Scape Berky-Scape
item.description:
@Berky-Scape wrote:

if you wan’t some help with the firewall to allow things?
Do this : go to start on your computer
2. click on the button with confrigation or something like that.
3. click on the shield thing named security center (i got a dutch computer and i’m dutch cuz that i don’t know how it looks like on the enlish computers)
4. click on firewall
5. you will see a little screen click above on “exceptions” and typ the things what you wan’t to allow on your firewall

i hope this helped
it helped not? tell your problems to me than i look how to fix.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with my server plz!
item.dc:creator: @Scarr Scarr
item.description:
@Scarr wrote:

If you have your No-ip check marked, with No-Ip DUC, and you have it port-forwarded, along with the port 43594 on TCP and UDP on your firewall allowing it through, then yes, it will work.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with my server plz!
item.dc:creator: @Pk2pk_Owner Pk2pk Owner
item.description:
@Pk2pk_Owner wrote:

Wait let me just check keep refreshin plz ill brb[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 11, 2008, 01:01:30 pm[/size][hr]ok is this right?

Add Services

Service Definition
Name: Pk2pk.no-ip.org
Type: TCP UDP TCP/UDP
Start Port: 43594
Finish Port: 43594

    [br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 11, 2008, 01:03:41 pm[/size][hr]Bump.

item.title: Need help with my server plz!
item.dc:creator: @Scarr Scarr
item.description:
@Scarr wrote:

Have you port-forwarded through your router and allowed port 43594 through your firewall as both TCP and UDP?
